TextSection.Contents: A rare primary vascular anomaly characterized by mostly fusiform rarely saccular aneurysm of the superior vena cava. Patients can be asymptomatic or manifest mostly with dyspnea chest pain pain in the retrosternal region hypotension acute upper or lower respiratory tract infection symptoms and left arm paresthesias. It is usually incidentally detected due to the presence of mediastinal shadow in X-ray.

Parent.Label: Congenital anomaly of superior vena cava
